input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Freshly smoked salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of horserow root. 
   1.2) Truffle Frites Crispy fries tossed in truffle oil and sprinkled with parmesan. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Beef Wellington Beef fillet wrapped in puff pastry, served with a red wine reduction. 
   2.2) Pan-Seareded Halibut with Lemon Butter Sauce Flaky halibut seareded to perfection, drizzled with a zesty lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Sprouts roasted until crispy, seasoned with thyme and garlic. 
   3.2) Creamed Spinach Spinach cooked in a light cream sauce, garnished with chives. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a hint of almond, served with a berry coulis. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Pinot Noir A smooth, fruity red wine to pair with the beef. 
   5.2) Sauvignon Blanc A crisp, refreshing white wine to complement the fish.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Crab Cakes Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with herbs and spices, paned and fried. 
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Marinated artichoke hearts, served with a balsamic reduction. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Rack of Lamb with Rosemary Compound Butter A tender rack of lamb, grilled to perfection and drizzled with a rosemary-infused butter. 
   2.2) Grilled Chicken with Chimichurri Sauce Juicy chicken breasts marinated in chimichurri and grilled to a perfect char. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of root vegetables roasted until caramelized, seasoned with thyme. 
   3.2) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes infused with roasted garlic. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Apple Crumble A warm apple crumble with a crunchy oat topping. 
   4.2) Chocolate Lavaas A decadent chocolate lava cake, served warm with vanilla ice cream. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Chardonnay A rich, buttery white wine to pair with the chicken. 
   5.2) Cabernet Sauvage A robust red wine to complement the lamb.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Shrimp Cocktail Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, garnished with a sprig of parsley. 
   1.2) Mushroom Canapés Sautéed mushrooms atop a toasted baguette, topped with a creamy Béchamel sauce. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Seared Scallops with Truffle Oil A delicate scallop seared to perfection, drizzled with truffle oil. 
   2.2) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb A rack of lamb encrusted with fresh herbs, roasted to a golden brown. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Asparagus Asparagus spears roasted until tender, seasoned with lemon zest and olive oil. 
   3.2) Creamed Spinach Spinach cooked in a rich cream sauce, garnished with chives. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet A light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to balance the meal. 
   4.2) Chocolate Fondue A warm chocolate fondue with a variety of dipping fruits and pastries. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Pinot Noir A light and fruity red wine to complement the seafood. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With Lemon A refreshing option for those who prefer not to drink alcohol.

 Menu Week 5 (February 5th - February 11th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Crab Cakes Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with herbs and spices, pan-fried to a golden brown. 
   1.2) Grilled Octopus Tentacles marinated in olive oil, lemon, and garlic, then grilled to perfection. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seared Cod with Lemon Butter Sauce A flaky cod fillet seared to a golden crust, served with a zesty lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Herb-Crusted Venison A tender venison loin, encrusted with a blend of fresh herbs and spices, roasted to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of root vegetables, roasted until tender and caramelized. 
   3.2) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes infused with roasted garlic. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Tart A light and tangy lemon tart, served with a dollop of whipped cream. 
   4.2) Chocolate Truffles Rich, velvety chocolate truffles, rolled in cocoa powder. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) White Wine Selection A curated list of white wines to pair with the seafood and game dishes. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With Lemon A refreshing option for those preferring non-alcoholic beverages.

 Menu Week 6 (February 12th - February 18th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon with Cream Cheese A delicate slice of smoked salmon, served with a dollop of cream cheese and capers. 
   1.2) Truffle Mac and Cheese A rich and indulgent macaroni and cheese, infused with truffle oil. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seareded Duck Breast with Cherry Reduction A succulent duck breast, seareded to a perfect pink, served with a sweet cherry reduction. 
   2.2) Grilled Tuna Steak with Wasabi Mayo A perfectly grilled tuna steak, topped with a spicy wasabi mayo. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of roasted root vegetables, including carrots, parsnips, and turnips, seasoned with rosemary. 
   3.2) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes, enriched with roasted garlic and a touch of cream. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet A light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Chocolate Lava Cake A warm, gooey chocolate lava cake, served with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection A carefully chosen selection of red wines to complement the hearty main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water with Lemon A refreshing option for those who prefer a non-alcoholic beverage.

 Menu Week 7 (February 19th - February 25nd): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Shrimp Cocktail A plump shrimp served in a zesty cocktail sauce, garnished with a sprig of parsley. 
   1.2) Truffle Fries Crispy fries tossed in truffle oil and sprinkled with parmesan cheese. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seareded Chicken with Lemon Butter Sauce Juicy chicken breasts, seareded to a golden brown, served with a zesty lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Grilled Ribeye Steak with Garlic Butter A thick-cut ribeye steak, grilled to perfection, served with a garlicky butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Asparagus Asparagus spears roasted until tender, seasoned with olive oil and sea salt. 
   3.2) Creamed Spinach Spinach sautéed in a rich cream sauce, garnished with chives. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Tart A light and tangy lemon tart, served with a dollop of whipped cream. 
   4.2) Chocolate Truffle Cake A rich, moist chocolate cake studded with truffles, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Pinot Noir A smooth, medium-bodied red wine to pair with the chicken and steak. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water with Lemon A refreshing option for those who prefer a non-alcoholic beverage.

 Menu Week 7 (February 5th - February 11th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare A vibrant mix of smoked salmon, capers, and dicoles, served with a squeeze of lemon. 
   1.2) Truffle Deviled Eggs Eggs hard-boiled and then filled with a creamy, truffle-infused mixture, topped with a sprinkle of truffle shavings. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seareded Duck Breast with Chestnut Sauce A succulent duck breast, seareded to a perfect pink, served with a chestnut sauce. 
   2.2) Grilled Tuna Steak with Avocado Salsa A juicy tuna steak, grilled to perfection, topped with a fresh avocado salsa. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of roasted root vegetables, including carrots, parsnips, and turnips, seasoned with rosemary and thyme. 
   3.2) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes, enriched with roasted garlic and a touch of cream. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet A light and refreshing raspberry sorbet, perfect for cooling down after a rich meal. 
   4.2) Chocolate Truffle Cake A decadent chocolate truffle cake, served with a dusting of powdered sugar. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection A selection of red wines, including Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, to complement the main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water with Lemon A refreshing option for those who prefer a non-alcoholic beverage.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.52: Christmas Gala Dinner featuring Roasted Goose
checks_once.11: Saint Patrick's Day featuring Irish Stew
checks_once.45: random of Year Party featuring Gourmet Cheese Platter
checks_once.24: Father's Day Feast featuring Barbecued Ribs
checks_once.35: Summer Solstice Celebration featuring Midsummer Night's Fish Fry

checks_range.5: Squash and Pumpkin Delights featuring Pumpkin Pie

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse Rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We We continue our celebration with a focus on seafood and winter vegetables. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Crab Cakes Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with herbs and spices, pan-fried to a golden crisp.
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Marinated artichoke hearts stuffed with a creamy goat cheese mixture.
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Seared Scallops Served atop a bed of sautéed spinach and wild mushroom risotto.
   2.2) Grilled Salmon with Lemon Butter Sauce Flaky salmon fillet grilled to perfection, drizzled with a zesty lemon butter sauce.
3. Side Dishes 
   2.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Sprouts tossed with olive oil, garlic, and parmesan, roasted until crispy.
   2.2) Sweet Potato Fries Thinly sliced sweet potatoes fried to a golden brown, seasoned with cinnamon and sugar.
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate.
   4.2) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a hint of almond, served with a berry compote.
5. Drinks 
   5.1) White Wine Selection of crisp, dry whites to pair with the seafood.
   5.2) Hot Chocolate For those who prefer something warm and comforting.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
1. Appetizers
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare A vibrant mix of smoked salmon, capers, and dill, served on a bed of cucumber.
   1.2) Truffle Mac & Cheese Creamy macaroni and cheese infused with truffle oil, garnished with fresh truffle shavings.
2. Main Courses
   2.1) Beef Wellington Tenderloin wrapped in puff pastry, served with a red wine reduction.
   2.2) Pan-Seareded Chicken Breast Chicken breast seareded with a herbed butter, served with a side of roasted root vegetables.
3. Side Dishes
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables Carrots, parsnips, and turnips roasted until caramelized.
   3.2) Green Beans Almondine Green beans sautéed with almonds and a touch of lemon.
4. Desserts
   4.1) Apple Crumble Warm apple crumble with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
   4.2) Chocolate Lava Cake Molten chocolate cake with a gooey center, served with a dusting of powdered sugar.
5. Drinks
   5.1) Red Wine Selection of full-bodied reds to complement the hearty main courses.
   5.2) Hot Mulled Wine Spiced red wine warmed with cinnamon, cloves, and star anise.

 Menu Week 4 (January 29th - February 4th): 
1. Appetizers
   1.1) Shrimp Cocktail Fresh shrimp served in a zesty cocktail sauce, garnished with a sprig of parsley.

2. Main Courses
   2.1) Pan-Seared Cod Cod fillet seared to perfection, served with a lemon butter sauce and a side of asparagus.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Memorial Day BBQ' on 09-03 with a special dish: Smoked Brisket.
1.3 Celebrate 'Mother's Day Meal' on 05-13 with a special dish: Eggs Benedict with Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.5 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 03-21 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Pasta Wednesdays' every 5 weeks starting from Week 18, serving: Spaghetti Carbonara.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.52: Christmas Gala Dinner featuring Roasted Goose
checks_once.36: Memorial Day BBQ featuring Smoked Brisket
checks_once.19: Mother's Day Meal featuring Eggs Benedict with Salmon
checks_once.28: Bastille Day Party featuring Coq au Vin
checks_once.12: Winter Solstice Feast featuring Venison Stew

checks_range.5: Seafood Season Extravaganza featuring Fresh Seafood Platter

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse Rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We As we move into the second week, we continue our celebration with a focus on fresh and vibrant flavors. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Crab Cakes Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with herbs and spices, pan-fried to a golden crisp.
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Marinated artichoke hearts, drizzled with olive oil and bopped with lemon zest.
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Grilled Salmon with Dill Sauce Flaky salmon grilled to perfection, served with a tangy dill sauce.
   2.2) Beef Bourguignon Slow-cooked beef braised in red wine, served with a rich, velvety sauce.
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts tossed with olive oil, salt, and pepper, roasted until crispy.
   3.2) Truffle Risotto Creamy risotto infused with truffle oil and parmesan cheese.
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate.
   4.2) Crème Brûlée Rich custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust.
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection of full-bodied red wines to pair with the hearty main courses.
   5.2) Sparkling Water With a twist of citrus for a refreshing alternative.

1. Appetizers

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.
1.2 Celebrate 'Labor Day BBQ' on 05-01 with a special dish: Grilled Steak.
1.3 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-20 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-14 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.

1.5 Celebrate 'Spring Equinox Celebration' on 01-19 with a special dish: Wild Garlic Pesto Pasta.

We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Independence Day Celebration' on 07-04 with a special dish: American Apple Pie.
1.2 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 02-07 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Oktoberfest Beer Dinner' on 10-06 with a special dish: Sausages and Sauerkraut.
1.5 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 7 to Week 9 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

***

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-27 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 01-23 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Thanksgiving Dinner' on 11-22 with a special dish: Roast Turkey with Stuffing.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 9 to Week 10 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Dessert Sundays' every 3 weeks starting from Week 7, serving: Chocolate Lava Cake.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.4: Winter Solstice Feast featuring Venison Stew
checks_once.24: Father's Day Feast featuring Barbecued Ribs
checks_once.47: Thanksgiving Dinner featuring Roast Turkey with Stuffing

checks_range.9: Seafood Season Extravaganza featuring Fresh Seafood Platter

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse Rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We As we move into the second week, we continue our celebration with a focus on fresh and vibrant flavors. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare A blend of smoked salmon, capers, and dill, served on a bed of cucumber. 
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Salad Artichoke hearts marinated in olive oil, lemon, and herbs, tossed with baby arugula. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seared Scallops Seareded to perfection, served with a light lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Grilled Chicken Breast Marinated in a mixture of garlic, rosemary, and olive oil, served with a side of roasted asparagus. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Truffle Risotto Creamy risotto infused with truffles, garnished with parmesan. 
   3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy, drizzled with balsamic glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Lemon Tart A zesty lemon tart with a flaky crust and a smooth, tangy filling. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Rosé Wine A crisp rosé to pair with the lighter dishes. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With Lemon Slices For a refreshing touch.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
0 In the third week, we introduce a touch of warmth and comfort with hearty and comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Crab Cakes Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with spices and served with a remoulade sauce. 
   1.2) Goat Cheese Crostini Toasted baguette slices topped with goat cheese, honey, and walnuts. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Beef Bourguignon Slow-cooked beef braised in red wine, served with pearl onions and mushrooms. 
   2.2) Mushroom Risotto Creamy risotto made with wild mushrooms, parmesan, and white wine. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of carrots, parsnips, and turnips roasted until caramelized. 
   3.2) Garlic Butter Broccoli Broccoli florets tossed in a garlicky butter sauce. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Warm Apple Crisp A warm apple crisp with a crunchy oat topping. 
   4.2) Panna Cotta A silky panna cotta with a hint of vanilla and a berry compote. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine A selection of full-bodied red wines to complement the rich flavors. 
   5.2) Hot Chocolate A rich, velvety hot chocolate to warm up the evening.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Shrimp Cocktail Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, garnished with a lemon twist. 
   1.2) Truffle Fries Crispy fries drizzled with truffle oil and sprinkled with parmesan cheese. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Grilled Salmon with Herb Butter A perfectly grilled salmon fillet, brushed with a herbed butter sauce. 
   2.2) Braised Short Ribs Slow-cooked short ribs, served with a red wine reduction. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Cauliflower A colorful cauliflower roasted with olive oil, garlic, and thyme. 
   3.2) Creamed Spinach Spinach sautéed in cream and butter, seasoned with nutmeg. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Fondue A warm chocolate fondue with a variety of dipping fruits and marshmallows. 
   4.2) Cheesecake A rich and creamy cheesecake with a graham cracker crust. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Pinot Noir A light and fruity pinot noir to pair with the main courses. 
   5.2) White Wine A crisp and refreshing white wine to complement the lighter dishes.

 Menu Week 5 (February 5th - February 11th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Oysters Rockefeller Fresh oysters topped with a rich and buttery spinach and mushroom sauce. 
   1.2) Deviled Eggs Stuffed eggs filled with a spicy mayonnaise and garnished with paprika. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Rack of Lamb A tender rack of lamb, roasted to perfection and served with a mint jelly. 
   2.2) Grilled Tuna Steak A perfectly grilled tuna steak, served with a wasabi aioli. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and sweet. 
   3.2) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes infused with roasted garlic. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet A light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to balance the savory dishes. 
   4.2) Chocolate Truffle Cake A decadent chocolate cake with a truffle ganache filling. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine A selection of robust red wines to complement the main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With Lemon A refreshing option for those who prefer not to drink alcohol.

 Menu Week 6 (February 12th - February 18th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Shrimp Cocktail A plump shrimp served in a zesty cocktail sauce, garnished with a lemon wedge. 
   1.2) Mini Quiche Lorraine Miniature quiches filled with a savory egg and cheese mixture, baked to perfection. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seareded Chicken Breast Chicken breasts seareded to a golden brown, served with a lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Grilled Swordfish Steaks Swordfish steaks grilled to perfection, served with a chimichurri sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Asparagus Asparagus spears roasted with olive oil and sea salt. 
   3.2) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Tart A light and tangy lemon tart with a flaky crust. 
   4.2) Vanilla Bean Ice Cream A scoop of rich vanilla bean ice cream, drizzled with caramel sauce. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) White Wine A selection of crisp white wines to pair with the seafood and chicken dishes. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With Lemon Slices For a refreshing alternative, sparkling water with a slice of lemon.

 Menu Week 7 (February 19th - February 25th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Canapés Thin slices of smoked salmon served on toasted baguette rounds, topped with a dollop of crème fraîche.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Mid-Autumn Festival' on 09-24 with a special dish: Mooncakes.
1.2 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.
1.3 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 04-06 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.4 Celebrate 'Labor Day BBQ' on 05-01 with a special dish: Grilled Steak.
1.5 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
2) Feature 'Mushroom Season Specials' from Week 22 to Week 25 with dishes like: Various Mushroom Dishes.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 3, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (4, 9) for university use.
  - Designate Block at (9, 7) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (5, 3) for sports complex use.
  - Designate Block at (0, 5) for museum use.
  - Designate Block at (3, 3) for library use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the column from (1, 9) to (4, 9).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a bus station starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 2 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0): 
This block is the entry point to the cultural quarter and is dedicated to a contemporary art gallery. The details are as follows: Architecture: The building is designed with expansive glass facades and a minimalist aesthetic, making it a landmark in the cityscape. Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. Purpose: The gallery showcases a wide range of artworks from both local and international artists. It serves as a platform for cultural exchange and artistic expression, featuring everything from traditional paintings to modern digital installations. City Value: As a pivotal part of the cultural quarter, this gallery enhances the city's reputation as a center for arts and culture. It attracts tourists and art lovers, providing a significant boost to the local economy. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure that the document contains detailed descriptions for each block, with a minimum of 150 words per description. Ensure clarity and continuity in the narrative throughout the document without any interruptions or omissions. When all block assignments are complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (1, 7) for hospital use.
  - Designate Block at (7, 2) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (9, 7) for fire station use.
  - Designate Block at (0, 8) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (3, 2) for sports complex use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a cultural quarter along the row from (1, 3) to (1, 4).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0): 
This block is the entry point to the cultural quarter and is dedicated to a contemporary art gallery. The details are as follows: Architecture: The building is designed with expansive glass facades and a minimalist aesthetic, making it a landmark in the cityscape. Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. Purpose: The gallery showcases a wide range of artworks from both local and international artists. It serves as a platform for cultural exchange and artistic expression, featuring everything from traditional paintings to modern digital installations. City Value: As a pivotal part of the cultural quarter, this gallery enhances the city's reputation as a center for arts and culture. It attracts tourists and art lovers, providing a significant boost to the local economy. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure that the document contains detailed descriptions for each block, with a minimum of 150 words per description. Ensure clarity and continuity in the narrative throughout the document without any interruptions or omissions. When all block assignments are complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

2) Range block requirements: Allocate a educational complex along the row from (9, 5) to (9, 6).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (7, 9) for university use.
  - Designate Block at (3, 2) for residential area use.
  - Designate Block at (9, 4) for fire station use.
  - Designate Block at (4, 5) for shopping mall use.
  - Designate Block at (8, 8) for commercial zone use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a cultural quarter along the row from (1, 2) to (1, 4).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0): 
This block is the entry point to the cultural quarter and is dedicated to a contemporary art gallery. The details are as follows: Architecture: The building is designed with expansive glass facades and a minimalist aesthetic, making it a landmark in the cityscape. Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. Purpose: The gallery showcases a wide range of artworks from both local and international artists. It serves as a platform for cultural exchange and artistic expression, featuring everything from traditional paintings to modern digital installations. City Value: As a pivotal part of the cultural quarter, this gallery enhances the city's reputation as a center for arts and culture. It attracts tourists and art lovers, providing a significant boost to the local economy. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure that the document contains detailed descriptions for each block, with a minimum of 150 words per description. Ensure clarity and continuity in the narrative throughout the document without any interruptions or omissions. When all block assignments are complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

  - Designate Block at (7, 3) for commercial zone use.
  - Designate Block at (1, 0) for residential area use.
  - Designate Block at (6, 2) for school use.
  - Designate Block at (9, 7) for farm use.
  - Designate Block at (3, 3) for library use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a industrial park along the column from (6, 5) to (7, 5).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a convenience store starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 2 blocks along the column.

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (4, 1) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (1, 9) for lake use.
  - Designate Block at (5, 0) for hospital use.
  - Designate Block at (8, 3) for cafe use.
  - Designate Block at (0, 6) for farm use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a large residential neighborhood along the row from (8, 1) to (8, 2).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a bus station starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0): 
This block is the entry point to the cultural quarter and is dedicated to a contemporary art gallery. The details are as follows: Architecture: The building is designed with expansive glass facades and a minimalist aesthetic, making it a landmark in the cityscape. Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. Purpose: The gallery showcases a wide range of artworks from both local and international artists. It serves as a platform for cultural exchange and artistic expression, featuring everything from traditional paintings to modern digital installations. City Value: As a pivotal part of the cultural quarter, this gallery enhances the city's reputation as a center for arts and culture. It attracts tourists and art lovers, providing a significant boost to the local economy. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure that the document contains detailed descriptions for each block, with a minimum of 150 words per description. Ensure clarity and continuity in the narrative throughout the document without any interruptions or omissions. When all block assignments are complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (2, 9) for commercial zone use.
  - Designate Block at (4, 7) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (4, 8) for school use.
  - Designate Block at (1, 6) for shopping mall use.
  - Designate Block at (2, 4) for university use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a educational complex along the row from (6, 5) to (6, 6).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a convenience store starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0):
